name: Cascadas de Chuijomil
description:
We rappelled the first two drops of this (95' from a small tree center canyon and 95' from a tree LDC) and then bailed at an easy escape LDC. This was followed by a big two stage (~190'?) with potential for some natural anchors in the big bowl maybe 120 feet down. From what we saw from the approach road west of the canyon, there are probably some even bigger waterfalls further down. The canyon below didn't look deep but it wasn't clear if there might be some committing sections due to how sheer the surrounding landscape is. The largest drop we estimated at over 220' but with a big mid-wall hanging bowl with potential for natural anchors. This canyons is a good candidate for bolting. Probably over 8 rappels.

Approach

Drive up the gravel road that switchbacks up from the top of Tzununa and look for a big trail on a switchback used to access the milpas east of the road.

Descent

Exit

would likely consist of walking back up the road to your vehicle or hiring a tuc-tuc back up.

Red tape

Beta sites

Trip reports and media

Background
